description.narrative: IR 2.4 By 2013, in 10 provinces, 30% under five children and pregnant and lactating women have access to and utilise quality community and facility based interventions for the prevention and management of malnutrition (Acute severe malnutrition, stunting and micronutrient deficiencies)., which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Child and Maternal Mortality are reduced through more equitable access to quality health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
HSS - public finance management for Health
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Multisector aid for basic social services
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Afghanistan Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015 to 2019 Extended until 2/2023 (see extensions 1 to 3)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015 to 2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Afghanistan 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.4 By 2013, in 10 provinces, 30% under five children and pregnant and lactating women have access to and utilise qualitycommunity and facility based interventions for the prevention and management of malnutrition (Acute severe malnutrition, stuntingand micronutrient deficiencies).
Number of SAM 6-59 months children admitted in community/facility-based services
Percentage of children 24-59 months dewormed at least once a year
Percentage of children 6-59 months receiving vitamin A at least once a year
